modName: Daedric Batch Files of Peerless Cheating - DELETED
summary: Max player, max vampire, max werewolf
descriptionHtml:
[size=5][b]Description[/b][/size]
[size=4]
These are my personal batch files that I decided to share. I normally play as an overpowered sneaky Daedric vampire archer. If this is not to your liking, you are free to alter the files however you choose to suit your own preferences.[/size]

[size=4]If you have never completed the game without using cheats, then I highly recommend achieving that a few times before using these. If you are like me and already played Skyrim normally for thousands of hours, then I recommend trying these. They will save you some time for sure.

The ingredients that are added are either needed to complete a certain mission or they are used in Invisibility Potions.[/size]

[size=5][b]Setup[/b][/size]

[size=4]Extract from archive and place text files into your main Skyrim directory, where your TESV.exe is located. Not the Data folder.

They should work flawlessly, assuming that your load order is correct:
[/size]
[size=4]00. Skyrim.esm[/size]
[size=4]01. Update.esm[/size]
[size=4]02. Dawnguard.esm[/size]
[size=4]03. HearthFires.esm[/size]
[size=4]04. Dragonborn.esm[/size]
[size=4]...etc.[/size]
[size=4]
[size=5][b]Instructions[/b][/size]

[/size][list=1]
[*][size=4]Once in game, you will need to tap the console code key, which for me is the tilde key or [color=#ff0000]~[/color][/size]
[*][size=4]Type [color=#ff0000]bat z[/color] and hit enter to max out your player completely and add lots of useful items[/size]
[*][size=4]I usually use [color=#ff0000]bat z[/color] at the very beginning of a game[/size]
[*][size=4]Type [color=#ff0000]bat w[/color] [size=4]and hit enter [/size]to add all Werewolf perks (once you have become a werewolf)[/size]
[*][size=4]Type [color=#ff0000]bat v[/color] [size=4]and hit enter [/size]to add all Vampire perks (once you have become a vampire)[/size]
[/list]
[b][size=5]Disclaimer[/size][/b]

[size=4][color=#ff0000]bat z[/color] will not only max out your player, but will also add a ton of useful items. Depending on your computer, this could temporarily bring your performance to a slow crawl or even crash your game. Please use at your own risk.[/size]

[size=5][b]Mods used in screenshots[/b][/size]

[size=4]Seranaholic v1.6 by rxkx22
4K Daedric Armor and Weapon Improvement for UUNP by GarryG Diablio and ShmooZ
Remodeled Armor for UUNP by ChronoTrigger77 Ousnius and Gamefever
Noble Skyrim by Shutt3r
Rustic Alchemy and Enchanting Tables by Gamwich
Rustic Animated Potions and Poisons by dailyplanet and Gamwich

[size=5][b]How to Create Insanely Overpowered Weapons[/b][/size]

[b]Dragonborn items needed[/b]

Ahzidals Genius: Increase your Enchanting skill 10 points.
Seeker of Shadows: Thief skills are 10% more powerful.
Seeker of Sorcery: Enchantments are 10% more powerful.

[b]Process[/b]

[/size][list=1]
[*][size=4]Get Seeker of Shadows[/size]
[*][size=4]Equip four items enchanted with Fortify Alchemy for head, necklace, arms, and ring[/size]
[*][size=4]Go to Alchemy Table and create Fortify Enchanting potions[/size]
[*][size=4]Get Seeker of Sorcery[/size]
[*][size=4]Equip Ahzidals armor[/size]
[*][size=4]Drink the Fortify Enchanting potion you made[/size]
[*][size=4]Enchant your armors and weapons (which will now be more powerful than before)[/size]
[*][size=4]Create new Fortify Alchemy items for head, necklace, arms, and ring[/size]
[*][size=4]Repeat the process until you are satisfied![/size]
[/list]
